definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech

sentences.chinese: 因此，我要需做一個開腔手術。

sentences.english: With the help of our iPhone opening tool, we pop out the logic board.
sentences.chinese: 在iPhone開腔工具的幫助下，我們撬開了主板。

sentences.english: Open head phrase is to be, how Xing picked up half and driven away?
sentences.chinese: 開腔的頭一句就是要盡人事，咋興撈起半截就開跑呢？

sentences.english: The Caterpillar was the first to speak.
There's only a communication that remains free until one doesn't begin to speak.
sentences.chinese: 只有通信仍然免費，直到一個不開腔。
